text: {| class="wikitable" align="right" style="margin: 1em; margin-top: 0;" ! colspan="3" | Asteroids discovered : 2 |- | 12575 Palmaria || September 4, 1999 ||rowspan="2"|with Paolo Pietrapiana |- | (69565) 1998 AZ4 || January 5, 1998 |} Luigi Sannino (b. 1981) is an Italian amateur astronomer. He is credited by the Minor Planet Center with the discovery of two asteroids in collaboration with Paolo Pietrapiana at the Monte Viseggi Observatory. Sannino discovered (69565) 1998 AZ4 at age 18, making him the youngest asteroid discoverer in the world as of 2017. == References == Category:Discoverers of minor planets Category:Discoverers of asteroids
title: Luigi Sannino
